fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Taxation, Single market, Banking and financial services
inter_groups: URBAN Intergroup (through participation in the European Real Estate Forum).
eu_initiatives:
Initiatives relating to the promotion of investment in the real economy, the financing of infrastructure (specifically commercial real estate) and the built environment, and long-term investment more generally. 
 
We are particularly interested in a number of elements of the Capital Markets Union, including the proposals relating to revival of the securitisation market. 
 
Other financial sector regulation affecting commercial real estate lending, for example regulation affecting banks, insurers, and alternative investment fund managers investing in commercial real estate debt or advancing commercial real estate loans. We are interested in the review of Solvency II and the capital charges imposed under the standard formula on non-qualifying securitisation exposures. 
 
We are interested in market data and transparency, including through efforts (such as by the ESRB) to define, understand, monitor and manage financial system risks arising from the commercial real estate (debt) market.
organisation_name: Commercial Real Estate Finance Council Europe (CREFC Europe)
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership: We are a member of the European Real Estate Forum and of the UK Property Industry Alliance.  We are a sister organisation of the CRE Finance Council (which has a broadly similar remit to our own, but in relation to the USA) in the United States.
relevant_communication:
Promoting greater transparency and liquidity in commercial real estate debt markets. 
 
Promoting strategic, holistic and informed through-the-cycle regulation of commercial real estate lending markets. 
 
In particular, promoting the recommendations of the Real Estate Finance Group, an independent real estate industry group in the UK, as set out in its May 2014 report, "A Vision for Real Estate Finance in the UK". 
 
Collaborating with other industry organisations, including through the UK Property Industry Alliance and the European Real Estate Forum, to improve understanding of the role of commercial real estate investment (equity and debt) in the European economy, in relation to financial stability and from the point of view of investors.
